Material used.Material Name: Human brain tissue from Parkinson's patients and controls
Material used.Description: Immunoblotting was performed on human brain tissue samples from Parkinson's disease patients and healthy controls.

Readout description.Result Description: The p.G2019S variant in LRRK2 showed increased kinase activity compared to wild-type LRRK2.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 protein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare kinase activity between wild-type and mutant LRRK2.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: LRRK2 kinase activity within 10% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: LRRK2 kinase activity exceeding 20% of wild-type levels.

Material used.Material Name: Brain tissue from patients with SNCA p.A53T and controls
Material used.Description: Immunohistochemistry was performed on brain tissue samples from patients with the SNCA p.A53T variant and healthy controls.

Readout description.Result Description: The p.A53T variant in SNCA showed increased alpha-synuclein aggregation compared to wild-type SNCA.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA protein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Chi-square test was used to compare the frequency of alpha-synuclein aggregation between wild-type and mutant SNCA.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Alpha-synuclein aggregation within 5% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Alpha-synuclein aggregation exceeding 15% of wild-type levels.

Material used.Material Name: Brain tissue from patients with MAPT p.N279K and controls
Material used.Description: Immunohistochemistry was performed on brain tissue samples from patients with the MAPT p.N279K variant and healthy controls.

Readout description.Result Description: The p.N279K variant in MAPT showed increased tau phosphorylation compared to wild-type MAPT.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type MAPT protein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Chi-square test was used to compare the frequency of tau phosphorylation between wild-type and mutant MAPT.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Tau phosphorylation within 5% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Tau phosphorylation exceeding 15% of wild-type levels.
